channel.title: Very low FPS ATI 5770
channel.description:
So yeah, I have this XFX 5770, but wow, nothing is playable. A TF2 match, 800x600, 10-20 fps... Thats about the FPS I got with my motherboards integrated (700 mb ddr2).
[u]My PC specs are:[/u]
* XFX 5770 (1GB GDDR5) * AMD X2 240e (2.8 - 3.4GHz) <<< Maybe this? * ASUS M4A78-E Motherboard * 2 GB Kingston HyperX RAM * 500GB WDG HDD (32MB cache) * 750W PSU
I got the latest ATI 10.12 drivers. I don't really know what more detail I can give, but you can always ask.

item.title: Very low FPS ATI 5770
item.dc:creator: fx1
item.description:
Grief Reaper:

Well I have Gtx 460 768mb just a little better than your card. Did the same test for comparison…

Also goto run >type in dxdiag and run the program see if any problems come up, one thing is do all 5770’s run that hot…?

It’s not hot, I ran 4 tests before the one on the picture.

EDIT: Did a new benchmark on my newly re-installed PC, avg FPS = 27…

Read full topic

item.title: Very low FPS ATI 5770
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
nvidia cards seem to live longer, my friend exchanged his HD3870 for a used 8800GT in 2008, then I bought it and im still using it, meanwhile my friend already went through 3 radeons since then.

Read full topic

item.title: Very low FPS ATI 5770
item.dc:creator: The_Minotaur
item.description:
CTID:

From what I’ve heard, the 5xxx series of ATi cards is supposed to run cooler and more power efficiently than the new nVidia cards.

Yes, that’s probably true, however in my experience, nVidia cards give better results. Though I suppose that depends on the card to some extent, my nVidia cards have usually run faster and more smoothly. They are more temperamental though.

Read full topic

item.title: Very low FPS ATI 5770
item.dc:creator: Grief_Reaper
item.description:
From what I’ve heard, the 5xxx series of ATi cards is supposed to run cooler and more power efficiently than the new nVidia cards.

Well it seems that what you have heard is total bullshit. I’m interested though if anyone who has a 5770 or above can beat my 55°C with FurMark same settings, post em…

Read full topic

item.title: Very low FPS ATI 5770
item.dc:creator: GuitarJim
item.description:
I have seen lot’s of people having issues with the 5770, it seems to be driver related. Try reinstalling drivers, directx and verifying the game cache in steam.

There is also a hotfix for CCC 10.12 which may or may not help. If your still having issues I suggest trying an older driver.

Read full topic

item.title: Very low FPS ATI 5770
item.dc:creator: fx1
item.description:
pfannkuchen_gesicht:

have you already tried to reinstall DirectX, your video drivers and MSVC++ redist?

I updated my DirectX and when I rebooted, XP didn’t want to start again, so I’m in a “fresh” restart now. I’ll just download the 10.12 drivers for my 5770 then I’ll do another test of this Furmark.

Read full topic

item.title: Very low FPS ATI 5770
item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
Blevar:

I got the same gpu and i can run tf2 in 5760x1080 resolution no problem. U should too.
But make sure that no youtube or any other flash websites run in the background cuz ati if u do ati underclocks itself to 400mhz/800mhz instead of 850/1200.

jesus christ I hope that’s a dual screen res

Read full topic

item.title: Very low FPS ATI 5770

item.description:
I got the same gpu and i can run tf2 in 5760x1080 resolution no problem. U should too.
But make sure that no youtube or any other flash websites run in the background cuz ati if u do ati underclocks itself to 400mhz/800mhz instead of 850/1200.

item.title: Very low FPS ATI 5770
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Open your task manager and see if your ram/cpu is being constantly used, also close all open programs before running TF2

Change multi-core rendering and color correction (in TF2) to off if it’s on.

Read full topic

item.title: Very low FPS ATI 5770
item.dc:creator: russilker
item.description:
It’s recognizing the card fine and the card is running at the full core and mem frequency, so I don’t think its a hardware issue. Unless the video card is faulty, I’m thinking its some software thats hampering performance, like a virus or something. I would do a clean reinstall at this point.

Read full topic

item.title: Very low FPS ATI 5770
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
I know ati cards use less power than nvidia, but I’d say it’s either a faulty power supply or incompatible motherboard.

Read full topic

item.title: Very low FPS ATI 5770
item.dc:creator: fx1
item.description:
Medevilae:

None of that should be giving you 10-20 FPS. Something else is wrong.

Is TF2 the only game that’s giving you low FPS?

I don’t really have any other game to compare to ATM, but what I do remember is that, yes… mostly

pfannkuchen_gesicht:

did you disable the IGP?

Yes

Medevilae:

Is your monitor plugged into the IGP or your discrete video card?

It’s plugged into the 5770

item.title: Very low FPS ATI 5770
item.dc:creator: fx1
item.description:
So yeah, I have this XFX 5770, but wow, nothing is playable.
A TF2 match, 800x600, 10-20 fps… Thats about the FPS I got with my motherboards integrated (700 mb ddr2).

My PC specs are:

  • XFX 5770 (1GB GDDR5)
  • AMD X2 240e (2.8 - 3.4GHz) <<< Maybe this?
  • ASUS M4A78-E Motherboard
  • 2 GB Kingston HyperX RAM
  • 500GB WDG HDD (32MB cache)
  • 750W PSU

I got the latest ATI 10.12 drivers.
I don’t really know what more detail I can give, but you can always ask.
